channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Film: More people needed to work with Hollywood stars
item.description: Forest Whitaker and Tom Hardy have filmed in Wales - but sector says it needs people to help stars.

item.title: Covid: Pupils return to Wales' schools amid concerns
item.description: With Wales at alert level zero, the Welsh government says it will keep an eye on Covid cases.

item.title: Winnie-the-Pooh: Collectable coins to mark bear's 95th anniversary
item.description: The Royal Mint commemorate the world's favourite fictional bear's 95th birthday with nine-piece set.

item.title: Barry Biomass hit with order to shut down in planning row
item.description: Campaigners have fought against plans for the wood incinerator for years amid pollution fears.

item.title: Covid: Ministers accused of U-turn over ozone machines
item.description: Schools were promised 1,000 devices to disinfect classrooms, but plans now appear to be on hold.

item.title: Carer shortage leaves Wrexham man, 89, stuck in hospital
item.description: He is unable to leave after five weeks in hospital due to a lack of community carers, his wife says.

item.title: Lorry hits bridge in Machynlleth, closing A487 and railway
item.description: Traffic Wales says motorists should plan ahead as the road is expected to be closed for some time.

item.title: Covid-19 death toll passes 8,000 mark in Wales
item.description: There have been 8,002 deaths involving Covid in Wales since the pandemic began, figures show.

item.title: Third Covid jab advised for most vulnerable 1%
item.description: More than 400,000 people in the UK are eligible - but plans for further boosters are yet to be confirmed.

item.title: Logan Mwangi: Cause of death not yet known, inquest hears
item.description: Inquest opens into death of five-year-old Logan Mwangi's whose body was found in a river by police.

item.title: Nevill Hall doctor struck off for working while on sick pay
item.description: Dr Joao Muel's behaviour is found to be "fundamentally incompatible with being a doctor".

item.title: Hospitality: Plea to allow outdoor seating after Gwynedd Council ban
item.description: Dining marquees are taking up parking spaces and the council says others have complained.

item.title: Carer shortage leaves Wrexham man 'stranded' in hospital
item.description: Gwyneth Taylor's husband Ronald is unable to go home because of a shortage of carers.

item.title: Drugs: The county lines gang in our Powys cul-de-sac
item.description: What happens when drug dealers move in to a small, rural town?

item.title: Climate change: Meet the people taking action
item.description: A goods swap shop and DIY flood defenders are just some ideas people have put into practice.

item.title: Covid: The doctor busting Covid vaccine myths on social media
item.description: Dr Bnar Talabani has been trying to encourage young people on TikTok to get jabbed.

item.title: Rugby: Mixed ability club in Llanelli marks 25 years
item.description: About half of the club's players are registered disabled and most have learning disabilities.

item.title: Stormzy, Skepta and Aitch: Making beats for rap stars at 19
item.description: Chris Rich has made thousands from creating beats in the style of hip hop's elite.

item.title: Robert Page: Wales boss pleased with 'positive' draw in Finland
item.description: Wales boss Robert Page says there were a lot of positives from Wednesday's 0-0 friendly draw away to Finland.

item.title: David Smith: How Tokyo boccia gold winner transformed his life during the coronavirus pandemic
item.description: David Smith successfully defended his Paralympic boccia title. Before the Tokyo Games< he told BBC Sport Wales how he transformed his life during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Finland 0-0 Wales: Harry Wilson misses penalty in friendly draw
item.description: Harry Wilson misses a penalty as a depleted Wales side are held to a goalless friendly draw by Finland in Helsinki.

item.title: Sarah Storey 'has carried on being the best she can' - Tanni Grey-Thompson
item.description: In her latest BBC Sport column, Tanni Grey-Thompson remembers meeting a 14-year-old Sarah Storey for the first time at the 1992 Paralympics.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Boccia player David Smith retains individual title with thrilling victory
item.description: Britain's David Smith likens himself to footballer Cristiano Ronaldo as he retains his Paralympic boccia individual title.

item.title: Pobl ag imiwnedd gwan i gael dos arall o frechlyn Covid
item.description: Mae angen amddiffyniad ychwanegol rhag Covid ar unigolion bregus, meddai'r Cyd-bwyllgor ar Frechu ac Imiwneiddio.

item.title: Dyn o Wrecsam methu dod adref oherwydd diffyg gofalwyr
item.description: Mae prinder difrifol o staff gofal cartref ar hyn o bryd, sy'n cael effaith ar draws Cymru, meddai'r cyngor.

item.title: Profi peiriannau oson ysgolion wedi pryderon diogelwch
item.description: Peiriannau sydd wedi eu dylunio i ddiheintio ystafelloedd dosbarth i gael eu profi ymhellach cyn i weinidogion eu prynu.

item.title: 300fed gêm i un o Ryfelwyr Llanelli
item.description: Mae Gwilym Lewis newydd chwarae ei 300fed gêm i Ryfelwyr Llanelli wrth iddynt ddathlu 25 mlynedd

item.title: Chwarae da ond dim goliau i Gymru yn erbyn Y Ffindir
item.description: Methodd Harry Wilson gic o'r smotyn wrth i Gymru baratoi ar gyfer gemau nesaf ymgyrch Cwpan y Byd 2022.
